content.text: He measures the length of the book, as shown in Fig. 1.1
The student records his measurement
His measurement is not accurate
Describe **two** ways that the student can improve the accuracy of his measurement
The book contains 200 thin sheets of paper
The student wants to find the average (mean) thickness of a sheet of paper in the book
Describe how he can determine such a small distance using only a ruler
The book has a mass of \(400\mathrm{g}\)
Calculate the weight of the book. Include the unit
[Total: 9]
A student measures a book
State the word used to describe the energy stored in the battery
Calculate the moment of the 3.0 N force about the pivot
moment = .........Ncm
The student does work as he opens the laptop
Explain how the principle of conservation of energy applies to this example
The student opens the laptop using a force of 3.0N, as shown in Fig. 2.1
The student is in a country with many hours of sunshine each day. He charges his laptop using a solar panel
Give two advantages of using a solar panel, compared with using a mains electrical supply
A mains battery charger has a power output of 80 W
The solar panel has a power output of 16 W
Describe **one** disadvantage of using the solar panel, compared with using the mains battery charger
A student has a laptop computer. The computer is powered by a battery
Determine the total time for the whole journey
Determine the time for which the car is not moving
Determine the distance between town A and town B
distance = .........km
Calculate the average speed of the car between 0 and 0.75h
average speed = .........km/h
The speed of the car before stopping at the garage is different from its speed after stopping at the garage
Describe this difference in speed and explain how the graph in Fig. 3.1 shows it
A woman drives a car from town A to town B. She stops at a garage during her journey
The distance-time graph for the journey is shown in Fig. 3.1
Calculate the force on the road from the tyre
The tyre is filled with air at high pressure
Use ideas about molecules to explain how this air exerts a pressure on the inside of the tyre
[Total: 7]
Fig. 4.1 shows a car tyre in contact with the road
The area of tyre in contact with the road is \(0.015 \text{m}^2\)
The tyre exerts a pressure on the road of \(240 \text{kN} /\text{m}^2\)
The main stages in the operation of a nuclear power station are listed below. They are **not** in the correct order
A
the turbine turns a generator
B
fission produces thermal energy
C
water in the boiler becomes hot
D
steam turns a turbine
E
nuclei split apart in the reactor
F
electromagnetic induction produces the output energy
G
Complete the flow chart to describe how a nuclear power station works. Insert the missing letters in the empty boxes
Some people are opposed to the use of nuclear power stations
Give **two** disadvantages of using nuclear power stations
One use of electricity is to turn an electric motor
The efficiency of an electric motor is always less than \(100 \%\)
State the meaning of the term efficiency
[Total: 7]
A nuclear power station generates electricity
The diagrams in Fig. 6.1 show _reflection, refraction_ and _diffraction._
On Fig. 6.1, write the correct word next to each diagram for the process shown
On Fig. 6.2, label the amplitude of the wave
On Fig. 6.2, label the wavelength of the wave
Fig. 6.2 shows a transverse wave
A thin converging lens forms an image of an object, as shown in Fig. 6.3
Fig. 6.3
Only one ray is shown in Fig. 6.3
On Fig. 6.3, draw **two** more rays from point X on the object that can be used to locate point Y on the image
[Total: 7]
The coils of the spring vibrate
Draw two arrows on Fig. 7.1 to show the directions of the vibrations
Through which of these is sound **not** able to travel? Tick **one** box
Very old people cannot hear the highest frequencies of sound that can be heard by young people
Suggest the highest frequency that very old people can hear
State the meaning of the term _ultrasound_
[Total: 6]
A sound wave is a longitudinal wave
Fig. 7.1 shows a spring being used to demonstrate a longitudinal wave
The circuit needs additional components so that
each lamp can be switched on and off separately,
the brightness of each lamp can be changed
Complete the circuit diagram in Fig. 8.1
Suggest the purpose of switch X
State the name of component Y and describe how it works
name
description
[Total: 7]
A theatre has three coloured lamps. Fig. 8.1 shows the circuit for the coloured lamps. It is not complete
A student has four similar metal bars. Two of the bars are permanent magnets, one is a bar of unmagnetised iron and the other is a bar of tin
In four different experiments, the bars are placed end-to-end in pairs, as shown in Fig. 9.1
State what happens to each pair of metal bars. Choose from the words attract, repel and no effect. You may use each word once, more than once or not at all.
The magnetic properties of soft iron and steel are different
Describe the differences
[Total: 4]
The transformer consists of two coils, labelled coil X and coil Y
State the name of each coil
X
Coil X has 6400 turns and coil Y has 400 turns
Calculate the voltage provided to the motor of the electric drill
voltage = .........V
[Total: 4]
A transformer is connected to a \(240\mathrm{V}\) supply. It is used to provide the correct voltage for the motor in an electric drill. Fig. 10.1 shows the circuit
Fig. 11.2 shows a plan view of the coil. The arrows represent the current direction at the top of the coil
On Fig. 11.2, draw lines to show the magnetic field due to the current in the coil
Draw **two** field lines above the line AB and **two** lines below it
Add arrows to show the direction of the magnetic field
An iron rod is placed inside the coil, as shown in Fig. 11.3
State the name given to the combination of iron rod and coil when used in this way
The arrangement shown in Fig. 11.3 is adapted to a number of commercial uses
Suggest one of these uses
[Total: 5]
Fig. 11.1 shows a coil connected in series with a d.c. supply
A scientist has a sample of a radioactive substance
Suggest how he can determine whether the sample is emitting \(\alpha\) -particles and whether it is emitting \(\beta\) -particles
The table lists the charge and location of particles in an atom
Complete the table by stating the charge and the location for each type of particle in an atom
[Total: 7]
